videos.title: KOMA SAXO feat. SOFIA JERNBERG @ House of Music | LIVE IN BERLIN
videos.description:
A highly potent lineup of five heavy jazz names on the Berlin‚ÄìNordics axis, including Eldh on bass, Christian Lillinger on drums and the frontline of three saxes: Otis Sandsj√∂, Jonas Kullhammar and Mikko Innanen. Here also featuring Sofia Jernberg on voice! Make no mistake: this is not just another "supergroup", but a real band with their own sound and musical trajectory and Eldh's vision for the Koma Saxo sound is one step ahead of what groovy avantgarde jazz could sound like.

KOMA SAXO feat. SOFIA JERNBERG @ House Of Music, Berlin | 2022
Presented by Jazzexzess
Live In Berlin is a series by @berta.berlin.

videos.title: inEvitable feat. Hayden Chisholm "When a woman drinks" - live @ Studio B√∂rne | LIVE IN BERLIN
videos.description:
Researching the balance in the coexistence of composition and improvisation, precision and authentic personal expression, contemporary music, jazz and greek folk music, greek percussionist Evi Filippou formed the quintet in.Evi.table. Greek traditional rhythms, rembetiko melodies from the ‚Äô20s and reharmonisations of beloved folk songs flirt with the experimental sound of Berlin‚Äôs jazz scene. The listener enters a microcosmos which resembles at the same time a cabaret, a contemporary music concert, a greek feast and New York in the ‚Äô60s as Evi imagines it.

inEvitable feat. Hayden Chisholm "When a woman drinks" - live @ Studio B√∂rne | 2021
LIVE IN BERLIN is a series by @berta.berlin.

Original Composition: Vasilis Vasiliadis
Text: Pythagoras

videos.description:
Stella Chiweshe - live @ Club Gretchen | 2020

The queen of Mbira music from Zimbabwe - like Stella Chiweshe is affectionately called, is the first female artist who gained prestige in a music tradition that's been dominated by men: Mbira music. A breathtakingly powerful and highly spiritual performamce of one of the most original artists in the contemporary African scene using popular music to show the deepness and power of traditional spiritual music at home and abroad.

videos.description:
In the audiovisual concert the music of Mario Verandi meets the poetic images of Corinna Rosteck. Verandi's music features delicate, impressionistic piano melodies flowing over electronic textures. Rosteck's visuals of reanimated still images and slow motion of her moving shots follow the fluid and ephemeral. Music and images merge into an immersive, kaleidoscopic audiovisual experience.

videos.description:
Stella Chiweshe - live @ Club Gretchen | 2020

The queen of Mbira music from Zimbabwe - like Stella Chiweshe is affectionately called, is the first female artist who gained prestige in a music tradition that's been dominated by men: Mbira music. A breathtakingly powerful and highly spiritual performamce of one of the most original artists in the contemporary African scene using popular music to show the deepness and power of traditional spiritual music at home and abroad.

videos.title: FROLLEIN SMILLA is LIVING IN A BOX #12 | live at Club Gretchen
videos.description:
Frollein Smilla loves variety, in terms of style, instruments, even language. She loves the variation, and there's no lack of changes in tempo, dynamics, harmony and rhythm either. What she doesn't like is reduction to a common denominator. The concerts also celebrate the high art of musicality. Piano, accordion and multilayered horns, sensitive and energetic percussion, acoustic and electric guitars and basses are brought richly to life with great feeling and even greater skill. All this is crowned by the mesmerising, hearty harmonies of the polyphonic vocals in English, German and Spanish.

videos.title: REICH - RISSER - TOTENHAGEN live @ Radialsystem, Berlin | A L'ARME! Festival 2022
videos.description:
Improvisation with an attitude. Maria Reich, the violinist from Berlin, and the singer/performer, Laura Totenhagen from Cologne, move in a trance-like state between the worlds of jazz, modern classical, and performance art, lyric poetry and feminist activism. Collaborating here for the first time with the French pianist and composer Eve Risser, who regularly transforms her piano into a percussive and harmonious treasure chest.

REICH - RISSER - TOTENHAGEN - live @ Radialsystem, Berlin | 2022
A series by @berta.berlin and A L'ARME! Festival.
Watch all concert films here: https://www.alarmefestival.de/concert-films-alarme

Performer

EVE RISSER ‚Äî PIANO

videos.title: Liun & The Science Fiction Band - live @ Club Gretchen | LIVING IN A BOX
videos.description:
Urban music with dark beats, dazzling synths and pulsating hooks. Multilayered orchestral arrangements are contrasted with a frank and translucent voice that cuts through the clutter. The result is a phantasmagorical world that mirrors our contemporary state as an absurd, but wonderful combination of natural and virtual elements.

Liun & The Science Fiction Band - live @ Club Gretchen | 2020
Living In A Box is a series by Club Gretchen and @berta.berlin.

Lucia Cadotsch - voice
Dan Nicholls - keys
Andi Haberl - drums

videos.title: Y-Otis - live @ Club Gretchen, Berlin | LIVING IN A BOX
videos.description:
What you get is a form of "liquid jazz", born in an era where the understanding of jazz as a musical language has evolved way beyond the concept of the previous "modern". Informed by hiphop and electronic music, Y-OTIS is pure jazz in that the band stays true to its constant mission of creating a new form of musical communication.

Y-Otis - live @ Club Gretchen, Berlin | 2021
Living In A Box is a series by Club Gretchen and @berta.berlin.

videos.description:
3ZVO ‚Ä¢ Trip Jazz ‚Ä¢ Andrej Ugoljew and his Crew invite you into an energized world between hip-hop, afro funk and a nu jazz aesthetic. And 3ZVO (dreizvo 32) is Andrejs courier number at Berlin's finest bike-messenger collective ‚ÄûFahrwerk‚Äú- his other passion. Combining the movement of body, mind and soul is his definition of vibrant music, spiced with colorful sounds and spheres, constantly driven by extensive grooves. That‚Äôs Trip Jazz.

videos.description:

2 guys from 2 worlds 2 generations apart decided 2 play 2-gether.

videos.title: Justus Raym's Farmaporn - live @ Club Gretchen, Berlin | LIVING IN A BOX
videos.description:
Justus Raym's musical philosophy follows a certain set of rules or mantras, which he describes as "movement = sanity, static=insanity".
It is these phrases that are the inspiration behind the conception and drive of his work. Justus explores very different sides of his personality over beautiful, complex and enchanted musical pieces. Here he shares his honest feelings and intimate experiences.

Justus Raym's Farmaporn - live @ Club Gretchen, Berlin.
A series by @berta.berlin and Club Gretchen.

videos.title: Els & The Bliss - live @ sowieso | LIVE IN BERLIN
videos.description:
Els & The Bliss first saw daylight in 2019 in a dark basement in Berlin-Kreuzberg. Since then they are offering a refreshing change from the mundane. The band emerged from a special concert of Lychee Lassi, featuring their original drummer Based (Seeed) and substituting vibraphone for turntables. The band improvises with fear of neither beats, riffs, nor licks!

videos.title: Andromeda Mega Express Orchestra - live @ Radialsystem, Berlin | KOSMOSTAGE IV
videos.description:
Celebrating its 15th anniversary this year, Berlin-based Andromeda Mega Express Orchestra is opening the festival Kosmostage IV with a program by ensemble leader/composer Daniel Glatzel. Looking within, the first two titles are impressions which are formally structured and orchestrated but each time collectively shaped anew in swarm-like and fluid movements. The 18-minute ‚ÄúCurrents‚Äù flows through complex swaying rhythms steadily upstream, whatever may come, on and on.

A unique skill set of beatboxing, vocals, piano and synthesizer meets poetic lyrics and rhythmic virtuosity. videos.title: Stefan Schultze Large Ensemble "The Buchla Suite" - Rehearsal | LIVE IN BERLIN
videos.description:
The Buchla Suite: A Handcrafted Tribute to Morton Subotnick is the latest project and sound-exploration vehicle for Stefan Schultze‚Äôs Large Ensemble. The project was inspired by Morton Subotnick‚Äôs seminal composition Silver Apples of the Moon, which was released in 1967on Nonesuch Records. The piece was written for the Buchla-100 synthesizer, which Subotnick designed in collaboration with engineer Don Buchla. The introduction of this instrument, and Subotnick‚Äôs compositions which utilised it, defined what is now considered the West-Coast style of sound synthesis. His work has had a lasting impact on generations of electronic and electroacoustic musicians.

Stefan Schultze Large Ensemble "The Buchla Suite" - Rehearsal | 2022
Live In Berlin is a series by @berta.berlin.

Performer
Almut K√ºhne  - vocals

Integrated with and juxtaposed to the music are the live drawings and light projections by Lena Czerniawska, adding their own distinct dynamic to each of the three pieces and influence the sonic proceedings by visual means. videos.description:
This extraordinary percussion ensemble around Francesco D'Auria and G√ºnter "Baby" Sommer have been around for 35 years: The magical world of percussion, the ongoing search for new sounds from the instruments, the somnambulistic connection between the musicians - all this makes Percussion Staff so unique. The song of the elements of drum skins, wood, metal, water is joined by the melodic sound of marimba and vibraphone, trumpet and flugelhorn, whistle and shell and human voice, combine to form music that smells of the sea and olives, in which one can Hear the buzzing of the crickets.

videos.title: Lapsus Lumine "Moondog Project" - live @ Radialsystem, Berlin | A L'ARME! Festival 2021
videos.description:
When Louis Thomas Hardin died in M√ºnster in 1999, the world lost a true visionary. But the legend that he created lives on: that of his alter ego Moondog, a blind Viking who stood on New York street corners and, in connection with primal forces, dreamt up an otherworldly music that has left a lasting impact on jazz greats and minimalists.

The Moondog Project was created to pay homage to this legend. Together with Ernst Reijseger on the cello and Jim Black on the drums, the vocalists Marta del Grandi, Sabrina Oggero Viale and Erika Sofia Sollo as well as bassist Stefano Risso (the four of whom are also known as Lapsus Lumine) reinterpret Moondog‚Äôs works and also present their own compositions that have been inspired by his aesthetic. A loving tribute. The legend lives on.

Lapsus Lumine - live @ Radialsystem, Berlin | 2021
A series by @berta.berlin and A L'ARME! Festival.
Watch all concert films here: https://www.alarmefestival.de/concert-films-alarme

videos.title: FROLLEIN SMILLA are LIVING IN A YARD | live at Club Gretchen
videos.description:
Frollein Smilla loves variety, in terms of style, instruments, even language. She loves the variation, and there's no lack of changes in tempo, dynamics, harmony and rhythm either. What she doesn't like is reduction to a common denominator. The concerts also celebrate the high art of musicality. Piano, accordion and multilayered horns, sensitive and energetic percussion, acoustic and electric guitars and basses are brought richly to life with great feeling and even greater skill. All this is crowned by the mesmerising, hearty harmonies of the polyphonic vocals in English, German and Spanish.

videos.description:

videos.title: Zbigniew Chojnacki - live @ Radialsystem, Berlin | A L'ARME! FESTIVAL 2021
videos.description:
According to Zbigniew Chojnacki, he can be inspired by a washing machine or an empty chair in the middle of a stage. Or an old accordion, surrounded by effect pedals, loop machines and other landmines of sound.

This is the set-up that the Polish musician currently uses to generate new ideas and truly unexpected sounds. Often dismissed as a sort of ‚Äúfolklore jukebox‚Äù, Pauline Oliveros has already demonstrated the possibilities hidden within the humble accordion. In Chojnacki‚Äôs hands, the instrument is in a permanent state of metamorphosis. At one point, it seems to be a cross between a typewriter and a bellows. At first meditative like an endless drone, then exhilarating like a washing machine drum during a spin cycle.

Zbigniew Chojnacki - live @ Radialsystem, Berlin | 2021
A series by @berta.berlin and A L'ARME! Festival.

videos.description:
Sometimes one feels reminded of an amber, in whose light-darkened inner life figures are enclosed that led a completely different existence ages ago. One believes one can hear through the pieces and yet remains trapped in them. None of the four musicians play their narrative against the wall, but doors, windows, portals and hatches are created everywhere, inviting you to slip through. In this way, one can always find access from a new perspective.

For their Hinterhalt Performance at Deutsche Oper Berlin Polypore composed music for brass ensemble and three opera singers,  reacting to Wagner‚Äôs Rheingold and combining these new compositions with tracks from their album ‚ÄûJuniper‚Äú which was just released on akkerbouw records.

videos.title: Elias Stemeseder "Lem Botanik" - live @ House Of Music, Berlin | BITCHES BREW FESTIVAL
videos.description:
Elias Stemeseder' music has passion. He sounds as if he is spearing small, agile fish with his rapid fire piano notes before tapering the intensity down into a sweet, inward reverie. He uses repetition nicely, weaving in the ominous and molding unsettled segments of sound with serenity and pure beauty. What we get is a revelation of the artist's heart, mind and soul. It happens here. It is a wonderful combination of fragility, drive, and unwavering tensile strength and talent, brimming with a sense of wide-eyed and fearless adventure.

Elias Stemeseder "Lem Botanik" - live @ House Of Music, Berlin | 2021
A series by Bitches Brew Festival and @berta.berlin.

Yusuf Sahilli might sound like a blues man, or a new romantic, growling about wild nights spent searching, or letting his sweet tenor voice indulge in lustful melancholy moods. Fully buzzed on global sounds and brimming with boundless feel good passion and sympathy for the whole wide world. Yusuf had connected to the Alternative Rock soundtrack of his generation and dug deep and fast into the history of the trade. From the Rock dinosaurs and the golden age of Pop through the Hippie era, the Beat of the Sixties and the protest movement right down to the founding fathers of the Blues in the Delta.

videos.description:
German for ‚Äúthe pink meeting point,‚Äù ‚ÄúTreffpunkt Pink‚Äù sees six musicians form a swarm that moves through an expanse of synthesizer-generated landscapes. Said landscapes come with different tonal fields, each of which is assigned a color: ‚ÄúPink‚Äù is one of six possible ‚Äúmeeting points‚Äù for the swarm to gather and rest for a moment before moving on and drifting apart once again.

videos.title: Peter Zegveld & Terrie Ex - live @ Radialsystem, Berlin | A L'ARME! Festival
videos.description:
When the pot boils over, the feedback wails and the tea kettle whistles, it‚Äôs clear: Peter Zegveld and Terrie Ex are about to shock your system. The Dutch duo transform former industrial production lines into an adventurous audio playground. Musical craftsmanship becomes post-workerist expressionism. While performance artist Zegveld toils in his sound machine theatre like a deranged puppeteer, Terrie Hessels takes all of the power of deformation and the art of distortion that earned him the honorific Terrie Ex during his many years with The Ex and unleashes it full force on the guitar. Jazz that you can really let off steam to ‚Äì does that even still exist? It certainly does. And, with Zegveld & Ex, you can take that literally.

Peter Zegveld & Terrie Ex - live @ Radialsystem, Berlin | 2021
A series by @berta.berlin and A L'ARME! Festival.
Watch all concert films here: https://www.alarmefestival.de/concert-films-alarme

Performer
Peter Zegveld - sound machines

The term ‚Äúdoldrums‚Äù essentially means ‚Äúlull‚Äù or ‚Äúdead calm‚Äù ‚Äì and that‚Äôs exactly what happens in the most elegant way as ‚ÄúDoldrums deluxe‚Äù unfolds. Sleazy emotions are frozen in mid-air, as a beautiful nightmare of stasis and utter inertia takes over: despite the greatest efforts to shake things up, the musicians and the machine meet at a complete standstill.

videos.description:
‚ÄúLikolit‚Äù is the name of an abandoned linoleum factory that towers over the surrounding roofs of Kohlm√ºhle, a tiny village situated in the middle of the magical landscape of the Elbe Sandstone Mountains (between Saxony and Bohemia). The eponymous composition, inspired by the old plant and written by Johannes Schleiermacher, plays with the relationship between individual vs. swarm, thus creating a framework within the ‚ÄúCosmic Swarm Laboratory‚Äù where musicians, algorithm and sonographer can interact.

videos.title: Karkhana - live @ Radialsystem, Berlin | A L'ARME! Festival 2021
videos.description:
Since the mid-2010s, Karkhana‚Äôs seven multi-instrumentalists have been making music that is rooted in oriental traditions and continually grows in the direction of the future The group‚Äôs members have lived around the globe: from Egypt, Lebanon and Turkey to Germany all the way to North America. Yet Karkhana‚Äôs musical home is in the spiritual realm. Where elements of the Lebanese Oud tradition meet Egyptian Shaabi, the spirituality of Sufism, Jazz and Kraut (without the rock, according to the band themselves) in order to create a ‚Äúfree music of the Middle East‚Äù.

Karkhana - live @ Radialsystem, Berlin | 2021

videos.title: Festival video premiere | KLANGTEPPICH
videos.description:
With 4 world premieres!

00:00:00 Hadi Bastani [artist in residence] ‚Äì modular synthesizer
Yalda Zamani ‚Äì electronic sounds, codes, motion-sensors
Bastani works with field recordings, computers, modular synthesizers, transducers, and hacked electronic toys in the context of electroacoustic compositions, improvised performances, and site-specific, immersive and interactive installations. Zamani works with live coding and the application of machine learning models in combination with motion-sensing technologies.

00:30:58 RCO
Karl Heinz Jeron
As Klangteppich‚Äôs guests* of Noiselab festival, RCO realize an ephemeral, improvised and multi-layered sound installation with electronic circuits, wired everyday objects and different gadgets.
Noiselab is dedicated to experimental and electronic music at the interface of contemporary sound art and offers a common framework for improvisational musicians, sound tinkerers, electronic inventors and performance artists who want to present their non-commercial art and sound practice to a broad public and develop it collectively.

01:08:43 XEEN ‚Äì electronics
Orlando Boeykens ‚Äì tuba
Guitarist and producer Zhina Ardalan founded her solo project Xeen in 2019, and Orlando Boeykens is a sought-after tuba player in orchestras, chamber ensembles and bands. Xeen was curious to combine her sounds with those of the tuba, Boeykens was directly involved. Their performance celebrates noise and microtonality, reduction and opulence.

01:47:45 Rangarang Choir
Laura Winkler ‚Äì arrangements, direction
Winnie Br√ºckner, Omid Darvish, Sophie Grobler, Pejman Jamilpanah, Zola Mennen√∂h, Pari ‚Äì vocals
The composer and singer Laura Winkler arranges songs by the popular Iranian singers Hayedeh (1942-1990) Marzieh (1924-2010) and Ramesh (1946-2020) for a choir of Persian native speakers and singers who do not speak Persian. This project was made possible through funding by the Federal Agency for Civic Education.

videos.description:
The ‚ÄúPerseus Flock‚Äù comprises countless strings of all lengths and sizes surrounding a flute. Initially following New Age paths, it soon gets caught up in a thick undergrowth of blues quintet/classical roots, then looks for further possible pastures in traditional Czech folk terrain and eventually arrives on a musical plateau that links all those different spheres ‚Äì finally at peace with itself and its contradictions.

videos.title: Interstellar Waggle Swarm "Interstellar Waggle Crush" - live @ Radialsystem, Berlin | KOSMOSTAGE IV
videos.description:
A suite composed by Gregoire Simon, ‚ÄúInterstellar Waggle Swarm‚Äù sees various melodies and polyrhythmic structures join for a dance ‚Äì thus re-arranging and forming ever new swarm-like constellations and musical textures. The term ‚Äúwaggle dance‚Äù refers to the honey bee‚Äôs figure-eight dance that sees them shake and move in order to share information with the rest of the colony. Just like bees when a storm is about to erupt, the 17 ensemble members remain in tight-knit/constant vibration with each other, as they get carried away in trance-like states, fight the ensuing chaos and always find clever ways to converge wherever the tide is taking them‚Ä¶

Interstellar Waggle Swarm "Interstellar Waggle Crush" - live @ Radialsystem, Berlin | 2021
 Filmed by @berta.berlin.

videos.description:
‚ÄûMythos I - eio‚Äú was commissioned by Berliner Ensemble and Ersan Mondtag as one of four ouvertures for "-wÃ∂Ã∂aÃ∂Ã∂gÃ∂Ã∂nÃ∂Ã∂eÃ∂Ã∂rÃ∂Ã∂ Ã∂‚ÄìÃ∂ Ã∂Ã∂dÃ∂Ã∂eÃ∂Ã∂rÃ∂Ã∂ Ã∂Ã∂rÃ∂Ã∂iÃ∂Ã∂nÃ∂Ã∂gÃ∂Ã∂ Ã∂Ã∂dÃ∂Ã∂eÃ∂Ã∂sÃ∂Ã∂ Ã∂Ã∂nÃ∂Ã∂iÃ∂Ã∂bÃ∂Ã∂eÃ∂Ã∂lÃ∂Ã∂uÃ∂Ã∂nÃ∂Ã∂gÃ∂Ã∂eÃ∂Ã∂nÃ∂ (a piece like fresh chopped eschenwood)" recomposed by Thomas K√∂ck. The piece premiered on June 3rd 2021 at Berliner Ensemble.

Andrzejewski‚Äôs music has nothing to do with Wagner‚Äòs originals in the outcome, it‚Äòs rather a counter-draft. However, small material from Wagner‚Äòs overtures were chopped up and decontextualised and then used as composition material, or for the electronic elements in the pieces.

‚ÄûMythos II - a√ºe‚Äú was commissioned by Berliner Ensemble and Ersan Mondtag as one of four ouvertures for "-wÃ∂Ã∂aÃ∂Ã∂gÃ∂Ã∂nÃ∂Ã∂eÃ∂Ã∂rÃ∂Ã∂ Ã∂‚ÄìÃ∂ Ã∂Ã∂dÃ∂Ã∂eÃ∂Ã∂rÃ∂Ã∂ Ã∂Ã∂rÃ∂Ã∂iÃ∂Ã∂nÃ∂Ã∂gÃ∂Ã∂ Ã∂Ã∂dÃ∂Ã∂eÃ∂Ã∂sÃ∂Ã∂ Ã∂Ã∂nÃ∂Ã∂iÃ∂Ã∂bÃ∂Ã∂eÃ∂Ã∂lÃ∂Ã∂uÃ∂Ã∂nÃ∂Ã∂gÃ∂Ã∂eÃ∂Ã∂nÃ∂ (a piece like fresh chopped eschenwood)" recomposed by Thomas K√∂ck. The piece premiered on June 3rd 2021 at Berliner Ensemble.

Andrzejewski‚Äôs music has nothing to do with Wagner‚Äòs originals in the outcome, it‚Äòs rather a counter-draft. However, small material from Wagner‚Äòs overtures were chopped up and decontextualised and then used as composition material, or for the electronic elements in the pieces.

The music is played by a bunch of great musicians from the classical and improvising field.

videos.description:
Researching the balance in the coexistence of composition and improvisation, precision and authentic personal expression, contemporary music, jazz and greek folk music, greek percussionist Evi Filippou formed the quintet in.Evi.table. Greek traditional rhythms, rembetiko melodies from the ‚Äô20s and reharmonisations of beloved folk songs flirt with the experimental sound of Berlin‚Äôs jazz scene. The listener enters a microcosmos which resembles at the same time a cabaret, a contemporary music concert, a greek feast and New York in the ‚Äô60s as Evi imagines it.

videos.description:
Niklas Paschburg - live @ Theater im Delphi | 2020

The use of the piano; electronics (synth and computer) and his Grandfather‚Äôs piano accordion allows Niklas Paschburg to communicate via a number of musical traditions and languages. His music is unique in its ability to be both melancholic and positive, an embrace to lift anxieties and encourage meditation, whilst also making the listener want to move, dance and run.

videos.description:
Zola‚Äôs music touches on pastoral alternative folk, while splashes of classical decoration and melodic licks borrowed from jazz help illuminate unexpected corners. There is, in abundance, a songwriting sophistication in the mold of PJ Harvey or Beth Orton, a Southern Gothic shadow comparable to Neko Case and Nina Nastasia, and an omnivorous musical awareness that could stand alongside Cat Power‚Äôs varied arrangements.

videos.title: Jeannel - live @ Club Gretchen, Berlin | LIVING IN A BOX
videos.description:
Jeannel is one of the most progressive and versatile artists emerging from the Alt R&B scene today. Meandering through the deep, dark waters of femininity, love, sexuality and the subconscious, she integrates Experimental-R&B and Classical Songwriting.

Studying classical cello since the age of seven and growing up with a professional singer as a father, it is with no surprise that aptitude and musical intuition are united in her compositions, leaving them with the kind of depth and sophistication that propels her into the big leagues of the modern Indie world.

Jeannel - live @ Club Gretchen, Berlin | 2021
A series by Club Gretchen and @berta.berlin.

Jeannel - vocals

Shanice Ruby Bennett - bass

videos.title: KOMA SAXO feat. SOFIA JERNBERG @ House of Music | LIVE IN BERLIN
videos.description:
A highly potent lineup of five heavy jazz names on the Berlin‚ÄìNordics axis, including Eldh on bass, Christian Lillinger on drums and the frontline of three saxes: Otis Sandsj√∂, Jonas Kullhammar and Mikko Innanen. Here also featuring Sofia Jernberg on voice! Make no mistake: this is not just another "supergroup", but a real band with their own sound and musical trajectory and Eldh's vision for the Koma Saxo sound is one step ahead of what groovy avantgarde jazz could sound like.
